Subject: How Junit will test all assert methods, even if one or more assert methods
 fails in a TestCase?
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
X-Mailer: Lotus Notes Release 5.0.8  June 18, 2001
Message-ID: <OFE3BE7978.B4906A1C-ON65256BC9.00412DB7@...>
Sender: "Dajee B Metkari" <mdajee@...>
Date: Thu, 30 May 2002 17:28:22 +0530
X-MIMETrack: Serialize by Router on d23m0171/23/M/IBM(Release 5.0.9a |January 7, 2002) at
 30/05/2002 05:28:31 PM
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
From: "Dinesh B Metkari" <dinesh.metkari@...>
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=114637034

Hi,
I am having one testcase say:

testInsert(){

      assertTrue();
      - - - - -
      assertEqual();
      - - -
      assertXYZ()
}

In above case if first assert method i.e. (assertTrue())  fails, JUNIT
displays failure  which is occurred at
first assert only  & It dosent test or checks others assert() Methods.
My question is:
How Junit will test all assert methods, even if one or more assert methods
fails in a TestCase?

Expecting your immediate reply with solution.

Thanks & Regards,
Dinesh Metkari
subject: How Junit will test all assert methods, even if one or more assert methods fails in a TestCase?
